intro: Phlomoides pratensis, commonly known as meadow phlomis, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants known for their medicinal and culinary uses. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers are clustered in whorls and range in color from pink to purple. Phlomoides pratensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is also used in traditional herbal remedies.
